results.byline: By Rachel Sun, Mike Baker, Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs and Serge F. Kovaleski
results.title: 4 University of Idaho Students Killed in ‘Crime of Passion’
results.abstract: The authorities were still piecing together what had transpired at a home near the University of Idaho campus.

media.caption: Officers are investigating the deaths of four University of Idaho students at an apartment complex south of campus on Sunday. The authorities said they were treating the case as a homicide.
media.copyright: Zach Wilkinson/The Moscow-Pullman Daily News, via Associated Press

results.title: Grammy Awards 2023: The Full List of Nominees
results.abstract: Artists, albums and songs competing for trophies at the 65th annual ceremony were announced on Tuesday. The show will take place on Feb. 5 at Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles.

media.caption: Kendrick Lamar is up for eight awards at the 2023 Grammys, trailing only Beyoncé, who has nine.
media.copyright: Scott Garfitt/Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: E-Commerce;Computers and the Internet;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Jassy, Andrew R;Amazon.com Inc
results.title: Amazon Is Said to Plan to Lay Off Thousands of Employees
results.abstract: The job cuts of approximately 10,000, which would start as soon as this week, would focus on the company’s devices organization, retail division and human resources.

media.caption: The job cuts at Amazon would represent roughly 3 percent of its corporate employees and less than 1 percent of its global work force of more than 1.5 million.
media.copyright: Miles Fortune for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Virtual Currency;Bankruptcies;Computers and the Internet;Conflicts of Interest;Bankman-Fried, Sam;Ellison, Caroline (1994- );Zhao, Changpeng;HK FTX Trading Ltd (Futures Exchange);Alameda Research LLC;Binance;Bahama Islands
results.title: How Sam Bankman-Fried’s Crypto Empire Collapsed
results.abstract: Mr. Bankman-Fried said in an interview that he had expanded too fast and failed to see warning signs. But he shared few details about his handling of FTX customers’ funds.

media.caption: Sam Bankman-Fried, who was a cryptocurrency billionaire, lost nearly his entire fortune over the past week.
media.copyright: Erika P. Rodriguez for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Governors;Hobbs, Kathleen M;Lake, Kari A;Arizona
results.title: Katie Hobbs, Who Defied Trump in Arizona, Tops Kari Lake for Governor
results.abstract: Ms. Hobbs, Arizona’s secretary of state, narrowly defeated Ms. Lake, a former newscaster whose campaign was built on lies about the 2020 election.

media.caption: Katie Hobbs rose to national prominence when she stood steadfast against efforts by Trump loyalists to overturn the results of Arizona’s 2020 election.
media.copyright: Caitlin O'Hara for The New York Times

results.byline: By Monika Pronczuk, Matina Stevis-Gridneff and Jim Tankersley
results.title: G7 leaders held an emergency meeting to discuss the deadly blast in Poland.
results.abstract: The blast occurred a few miles from Poland’s border with Ukraine, on the same day that Russia launched a widespread missile attack on Ukraine.

media.caption: Poland’s defense minister, Mariusz Błaszczak, arriving at a security meeting in Warsaw on Tuesday.
media.copyright: Radek Pietruszka/EPA, via Shutterstock

results.title: ‘Targeted’ Killings and No Arrest Bring Fear to University of Idaho
results.abstract: The police said they did not have a suspect in custody, and were working to document the events that led to the deaths of four friends at a house off campus.

results.title: Trump Family Signs Deal With Saudi Real Estate Developer
results.abstract: The Trump Organization will license its name for a planned golf course in Oman, renewing questions about the former president’s mixing of politics and business as he appears poised for another run.

results.abstract: “Independent voters aren’t voting for our candidates,” Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida said at an event hours before Donald Trump was expected to announce a third presidential bid. “That’s a problem.”
